timeline.message:
#3518 update release notes for 2.2

Signed-off-by: Nigel Jones <nigel.l.jones+git@gmail.com>

timeline.author: davidradl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -23,12 +23,16 @@ and bad.  We would love to hear from you.
 
 Below are the release notes for the latest ODPi Egeria release:
 
- * [Release 2.1](release-notes-2-1.md) - July 2020
+ * [Release 2.2](release-notes-2-2.md) - August 2020

replies.bodyText: It's debatabe. so far I've followed the pattern in previous releases - the date represents when we cut the branch & have developed the work. The release lags a little - ideally it would be end of month, but this release things went on for longer due to some issues with the containers & janusgraph. So I would stick with August.
replies.author: planetf1

timeline.author: davidradl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,38 +1,22 @@
 <!-- SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0 -->
 <!-- Copyright Contributors to the ODPi Egeria project. -->
 
-# Release 2.2 (Planned August 2020)
+# Release 2.2 (August 2020)

timeline.author: davidradl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,38 +1,22 @@
 <!-- SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0 -->
 <!-- Copyright Contributors to the ODPi Egeria project. -->
 
-# Release 2.2 (Planned August 2020)
+# Release 2.2 (August 2020)
 
-Release 2.2 focuses on providing the secured self-service data access point
-for a data lake.  There are two main features:
+Below are the highlights of this release:
 
-  * **Metadata Controlled Security** where security tags based on the metadata attachments to the assets
-    drive the enforcement engine managing access control
-  * **Data Virtualization Configuration** where the data virtualization engine that is providing
-    the endpoint for the self-service access point.
+ * Additional connectors are now placed in our assembly under server/lib without dependencies. If you need to use a connector that requires additional dependencies that are not alreadypart of the server chassis, you will need to add those libraries here.

timeline.bodyText: Is there only one docker image? It might be worth having this as a link to it.
timeline.author: davidradl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,38 +1,22 @@
 <!-- SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0 -->
 <!-- Copyright Contributors to the ODPi Egeria project. -->
 
-# Release 2.2 (Planned August 2020)
+# Release 2.2 (August 2020)
 
-Release 2.2 focuses on providing the secured self-service data access point
-for a data lake.  There are two main features:
+Below are the highlights of this release:
 
-  * **Metadata Controlled Security** where security tags based on the metadata attachments to the assets
-    drive the enforcement engine managing access control
-  * **Data Virtualization Configuration** where the data virtualization engine that is providing
-    the endpoint for the self-service access point.
+ * Additional connectors are now placed in our assembly under server/lib without dependencies. If you need to use a connector that requires additional dependencies that are not alreadypart of the server chassis, you will need to add those libraries here.
+ * The docker image has been updated to use a later openjdk alpine base image due to incompatabilities with our Janus support in the old images for java 8.

timeline.author: davidradl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,38 +1,22 @@
 <!-- SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0 -->
 <!-- Copyright Contributors to the ODPi Egeria project. -->
 
-# Release 2.2 (Planned August 2020)
+# Release 2.2 (August 2020)
 
-Release 2.2 focuses on providing the secured self-service data access point
-for a data lake.  There are two main features:
+Below are the highlights of this release:
 
-  * **Metadata Controlled Security** where security tags based on the metadata attachments to the assets
-    drive the enforcement engine managing access control
-  * **Data Virtualization Configuration** where the data virtualization engine that is providing
-    the endpoint for the self-service access point.
+ * Additional connectors are now placed in our assembly under server/lib without dependencies. If you need to use a connector that requires additional dependencies that are not alreadypart of the server chassis, you will need to add those libraries here.
+ * The docker image has been updated to use a later openjdk alpine base image due to incompatabilities with our Janus support in the old images for java 8.

timeline.author: davidradl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,38 +1,22 @@
 <!-- SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0 -->
 <!-- Copyright Contributors to the ODPi Egeria project. -->
 
-# Release 2.2 (Planned August 2020)
+# Release 2.2 (August 2020)
 
-Release 2.2 focuses on providing the secured self-service data access point
-for a data lake.  There are two main features:
+Below are the highlights of this release:
 
-  * **Metadata Controlled Security** where security tags based on the metadata attachments to the assets
-    drive the enforcement engine managing access control
-  * **Data Virtualization Configuration** where the data virtualization engine that is providing
-    the endpoint for the self-service access point.
+ * Additional connectors are now placed in our assembly under server/lib without dependencies. If you need to use a connector that requires additional dependencies that are not alreadypart of the server chassis, you will need to add those libraries here.
+ * The docker image has been updated to use a later openjdk alpine base image due to incompatabilities with our Janus support in the old images for java 8.
+ * In the VDC chart, 2 new values have been added, 'ibmigc.connectorversion' and 'atlas.connectorversion'. In this release these are set to use the 2.1 connectors, since the connectors run to a different release cycle than the main egeria code. Once new connectors are released you can update these values to get the latest connectors

timeline.bodyText: ready for use => ready for use in production.
timeline.author: davidradl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,38 +1,22 @@
 <!-- SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0 -->
 <!-- Copyright Contributors to the ODPi Egeria project. -->
 
-# Release 2.2 (Planned August 2020)
+# Release 2.2 (August 2020)
 
-Release 2.2 focuses on providing the secured self-service data access point
-for a data lake.  There are two main features:
+Below are the highlights of this release:
 
-  * **Metadata Controlled Security** where security tags based on the metadata attachments to the assets
-    drive the enforcement engine managing access control
-  * **Data Virtualization Configuration** where the data virtualization engine that is providing
-    the endpoint for the self-service access point.
+ * Additional connectors are now placed in our assembly under server/lib without dependencies. If you need to use a connector that requires additional dependencies that are not alreadypart of the server chassis, you will need to add those libraries here.
+ * The docker image has been updated to use a later openjdk alpine base image due to incompatabilities with our Janus support in the old images for java 8.
+ * In the VDC chart, 2 new values have been added, 'ibmigc.connectorversion' and 'atlas.connectorversion'. In this release these are set to use the 2.1 connectors, since the connectors run to a different release cycle than the main egeria code. Once new connectors are released you can update these values to get the latest connectors 
+ * Further code to support lineage has been added, but in this release it remains in development and is not yet ready for use.

timeline.bodyText: and the Subject Area FVT is now in the build.
timeline.author: davidradl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,38 +1,22 @@
 <!-- SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0 -->
 <!-- Copyright Contributors to the ODPi Egeria project. -->
 
-# Release 2.2 (Planned August 2020)
+# Release 2.2 (August 2020)
 
-Release 2.2 focuses on providing the secured self-service data access point
-for a data lake.  There are two main features:
+Below are the highlights of this release:
 
-  * **Metadata Controlled Security** where security tags based on the metadata attachments to the assets
-    drive the enforcement engine managing access control
-  * **Data Virtualization Configuration** where the data virtualization engine that is providing
-    the endpoint for the self-service access point.
+ * Additional connectors are now placed in our assembly under server/lib without dependencies. If you need to use a connector that requires additional dependencies that are not alreadypart of the server chassis, you will need to add those libraries here.
+ * The docker image has been updated to use a later openjdk alpine base image due to incompatabilities with our Janus support in the old images for java 8.
+ * In the VDC chart, 2 new values have been added, 'ibmigc.connectorversion' and 'atlas.connectorversion'. In this release these are set to use the 2.1 connectors, since the connectors run to a different release cycle than the main egeria code. Once new connectors are released you can update these values to get the latest connectors 
+ * Further code to support lineage has been added, but in this release it remains in development and is not yet ready for use.
+ * User interface improvements.
+ * Ongoing bug fixes and refactoring especially in subject-area omas.

replies.bodyText: this was added in 2.1 & is in that version's release notes
replies.author: planetf1

timeline.bodyText: We should say Apache Atlas and Apache Solr.
timeline.author: davidradl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,38 +1,22 @@
 <!-- SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0 -->
 <!-- Copyright Contributors to the ODPi Egeria project. -->
 
-# Release 2.2 (Planned August 2020)
+# Release 2.2 (August 2020)
 
-Release 2.2 focuses on providing the secured self-service data access point
-for a data lake.  There are two main features:
+Below are the highlights of this release:
 
-  * **Metadata Controlled Security** where security tags based on the metadata attachments to the assets
-    drive the enforcement engine managing access control
-  * **Data Virtualization Configuration** where the data virtualization engine that is providing
-    the endpoint for the self-service access point.
+ * Additional connectors are now placed in our assembly under server/lib without dependencies. If you need to use a connector that requires additional dependencies that are not alreadypart of the server chassis, you will need to add those libraries here.
+ * The docker image has been updated to use a later openjdk alpine base image due to incompatabilities with our Janus support in the old images for java 8.
+ * In the VDC chart, 2 new values have been added, 'ibmigc.connectorversion' and 'atlas.connectorversion'. In this release these are set to use the 2.1 connectors, since the connectors run to a different release cycle than the main egeria code. Once new connectors are released you can update these values to get the latest connectors 
+ * Further code to support lineage has been added, but in this release it remains in development and is not yet ready for use.
+ * User interface improvements.
+ * Ongoing bug fixes and refactoring especially in subject-area omas.
 
-Below are the highlights:
+Known Issues
+ * In the VDC helm chart, the Atlas initialization job fails to complete. This is due to a problem with the Atlas server and SOLR. See https://github.com/odpi/egeria/issues/3587 for more information.

timeline.message:
#3518 Update release notes for 2.2 with review comments

Signed-off-by: Nigel Jones <nigel.l.jones+git@gmail.com>
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/odpi/egeria into issue3518c
